intro: Mattiastrum trinervium, commonly known as the three-veined mat, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with three prominent veins. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Mattiastrum trinervium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
